title: Moment crooks are yanked out of hotel hot tub to be arrested
text:
Cheshire Police arrested two criminals in their swimming trunks after they took a dip in a hotel hot tub (Picture: Cheshire Police)

CCTV footage shows the moment police swooped in to arrest two criminals who were enjoying a dip in a hotel hot tub.

One swimmer can be spotted continuing lengths of the pool while police take down the two crooks, who had a loaded gun in their room upstairs.

Cheshire Police received information that Kane Birch, 23, from Ainsbrook Avenue, who was their main target, was at the Village Hotel on Centre Park Square in Warrington on June 25.

When they arrived, they found Birch and Macauley Peacock, 24, from Blackley, climbing out of a hot tub, having both given fake names in order to book into the four-star hotel.

Upstairs in their hotel room, they arrested a third man, Dean Murphy, 20, from Manchester, who was asleep in a double bed.

After searching the room, officers found a loaded Glock pistol, along with an encrypted mobile phone and the key to a stolen Audi.

Birch was wanted by officers as part of an undercover operation by Cheshire Police’s Serious and Organised Crime Unit (SOCU).

At a previous court hearing on Friday 20 September, he was sentenced to four years for conspiracy to supply crack cocaine and heroin after he had a ‘significant role’ in orchestrating a county lines network to supply class A drugs from Manchester to local users in Macclesfield.

Peacock will serve 14 years in prison – five years for being in possession of a firearm and nine for arson with intent to endanger life.

He was found with £800 in cash, a fake Rolex watch and a key to a black Volkswagen Golf on the hotel’s car park, which was stolen.

On sentencing, Judge Simon Berkson named him a ‘dangerous offender’ and ordered him to serve a minimum of two thirds of his arson sentence.

Murphy was sentenced to eight years, five for being in possession of a firearm and three for heroin and crack cocaine offences.

Kane Birch was wanted by officers as part of an undercover operation by Cheshire Police’s Serious and Organised Crime Unit (SOCU) (Picture: Cheshire Police)

Macauley Peacock was found with £800 in cash, a fake Rolex watch and a key to a stolen black Volkswagen Golf (Picture: Cheshire Police)

Dean Murphy was found sleeping upstairs by police and sentenced to five years for being in possession of a firearm and three years for heroin and crack cocaine offences (Picture: Cheshire Police)

Officers seized a black bag on the windowsill which contained a loaded Glock pistol (Picture: Cheshire Police)

A search by officers also revealed he had two mobile phones, £165 in cash, a car key to a stolen Jaguar and a passport belonging to another person who was not at the hotel.

After the sentencing Detective Chief Inspector Mike Evans said the case showed that those who wished to harm people in the community would pay for their crimes.

He said: ‘This is yet another example of people travelling into Cheshire to inflict harm on our communities thinking they can get away with it – but my message is that we will relentlessly pursue them to ensure they pay for their crimes.

‘These men knew they were wanted by police yet they naively believed by hiding out in a hotel they would avoid detection – they were proved wrong.

‘We also recovered a loaded gun in what is a significant step in our fight against organised crime and has no doubt saved lives.’

description: CCTV footage shows the moment two criminals were arrested by Cheshire police in their swimming shorts after enjoying a dip in a hot tub.
